intro: Chamaefistula huilana, commonly known as the Huilá palm, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, fibrous fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
